titlepage.titleproper: Finding aid for the Almeda Girod papers
titlepage.author: Finding aid created by Bentley Historical Library staff

did.abstract:
Ann Arbor, Michigan resident. With her husband, she was stationed on a U.S. Naval base at Subic Bay, Philippines.
Letters home describe daily life and activities on the base.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Almeda Girod papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright status is unknown. Patrons are responsible for determining the appropriate use or reuse of materials.

bioghist.p: Almeda Girod of Ann Arbor, Michigan, was born in 1937. She and her husband Albert P. Girod, Jr., an American naval officer, were stationed at Subic Bay.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence written while Girod was living in the Philippines concerning living conditions and medical care. Letters describe Girod's daily life on the American base and her impressions of the Philippines.
